intro: Bauhinia leucantha, commonly known as the white bauhinia, is a tropical leguminous plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive bipinnate leaves and showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces flat, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and flowers. Bauhinia leucantha is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which benefits soil fertility.
